org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.optor

Class EconomicModelOptimiser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.optor.SkelOptor
      • org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.optor.ReplicatingOptimiser
        • org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.optor.EconomicModelOptimiser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Optimisable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EcoBinModelOptimiser, EcoZipfModelOptimiser

    public abstract class EconomicModelOptimiser
extends ReplicatingOptimiser
    This abstract class provides the getBestFile used by all economic model optimisers. If the auction protocol is used this method created a new Access Mediator to conduct each auction and returns the results. If the auction protocol is not used, getBestFile() of ReplicatingOptimiser is used and the economic decision of whether to replicate is in each subclass' implementation of chooseFileToDelete().

    Copyright (c) 2004 CERN, ITC-irst, PPARC, on behalf of the EU DataGrid. For license conditions see LICENSE file or http://www.edg.org/license.html

    Since:
    JDK1.4

    • Method Detail

      • getBestFile

        public DataFile[] getBestFile(java.lang.String[] lfns,
                     float[] fileFraction)
        Starts the auction process if it is to be used, or calls ReplicatingOptimiser.getBestFile() otherwise. The economic decisions are made in the subclasses' chooseFileToDelete() methods.
        Specified by:
        getBestFile in interface Optimisable
        Overrides:
        getBestFile in class ReplicatingOptimiser
        Parameters:
        lfns - The name of the files the CE needs to access.
        fileFraction - The fraction of each file the CE uses. This can be important in deciding whether it is better to replicate a file or read it remotely.
        Returns:
        The DataFiles the CE will access.

      • worthReplicating

        protected boolean worthReplicating(double potentialFileWorth,
                       java.util.List deleteableFiles)
        Tests whether the potential replica is more valuable than the deleteable files already on the SE.
        Parameters:
        potentialFileWorth - the value of the possible replica
        deleteableFiles - the list of deleteable files stored on the SE.
        Returns:
        true if the file is more valuable than existing files, false if not.
